name: Baumol Cost Disease / Stored Energy x Bass Diffusion S-Curve Positioning x Input-Output Table Disruption Propagation

component_methods.name: Baumol Cost Disease / Stored Energy
component_methods.description: Sectors where wages rose with the economy but productivity did NOT have the most 'stored energy' for AI disruption. Higher stored energy = more potential for cost collapse.

component_methods.name: Bass Diffusion S-Curve Positioning
component_methods.description: Estimates where AI adoption is on the S-curve for a given sector. Position determines strategy: pre-takeoff (evangelize), takeoff (ride), late majority (differentiate), laggards (skip).

component_methods.name: Input-Output Table Disruption Propagation
component_methods.description: Trace how disruption in one industry propagates to downstream industries through supply chain linkages. Built but never applied to real data.

cross_domain_question: Combining Baumol Cost Disease / Stored Energy + Bass Diffusion S-Curve Positioning + Input-Output Table Disruption Propagation: what happens when we apply these lenses simultaneously? Where do they agree on high opportunity?
falsifiable_prediction: Sectors scoring highly on ALL of [Baumol Cost Disease / Stored Energy, Bass Diffusion S-Curve Positioning, Input-Output Table Disruption Propagation] simultaneously will produce more actionable discoveries than any single method applied alone.

name: Counter-Signal / Bear Case Research x Composite Index Construction

component_methods.name: Counter-Signal / Bear Case Research
component_methods.description: Deliberately search for reasons an opportunity will FAIL. Counter-signals weighted 1.5x in grading.

component_methods.name: Composite Index Construction
component_methods.description: Build multi-indicator composite indices (P3 Cost Collapse, Capital Environment, Beveridge Curve) from normalized components.

cross_domain_question: Combining Counter-Signal / Bear Case Research + Composite Index Construction: what happens when we apply these lenses simultaneously? Where do they agree on high opportunity?
falsifiable_prediction: Sectors scoring highly on ALL of [Counter-Signal / Bear Case Research, Composite Index Construction] simultaneously will produce more actionable discoveries than any single method applied alone.

name: Bass Diffusion S-Curve Positioning x FRED/BLS Macro Indicator Screening x Counter-Signal / Bear Case Research

component_methods.name: Bass Diffusion S-Curve Positioning
component_methods.description: Estimates where AI adoption is on the S-curve for a given sector. Position determines strategy: pre-takeoff (evangelize), takeoff (ride), late majority (differentiate), laggards (skip).

component_methods.name: FRED/BLS Macro Indicator Screening
component_methods.description: Pull macro indicators (GDP, employment, wages, productivity, credit, JOLTS) from FRED and BLS to identify structural shifts.

component_methods.name: Counter-Signal / Bear Case Research
component_methods.description: Deliberately search for reasons an opportunity will FAIL. Counter-signals weighted 1.5x in grading.

cross_domain_question: Combining Bass Diffusion S-Curve Positioning + FRED/BLS Macro Indicator Screening + Counter-Signal / Bear Case Research: what happens when we apply these lenses simultaneously? Where do they agree on high opportunity?
falsifiable_prediction: Sectors scoring highly on ALL of [Bass Diffusion S-Curve Positioning, FRED/BLS Macro Indicator Screening, Counter-Signal / Bear Case Research] simultaneously will produce more actionable discoveries than any single method applied alone.

name: Baumol Cost Disease / Stored Energy x Herfindahl-Hirschman Index x Shift-Share Employment Decomposition

component_methods.name: Baumol Cost Disease / Stored Energy
component_methods.description: Sectors where wages rose with the economy but productivity did NOT have the most 'stored energy' for AI disruption. Higher stored energy = more potential for cost collapse.

component_methods.name: Herfindahl-Hirschman Index
component_methods.description: Market concentration measure. HHI < 1500 = fragmented (platform opportunity), 1500-2500 = moderate, > 2500 = concentrated (hard entry).

component_methods.name: Shift-Share Employment Decomposition
component_methods.description: Separate national, industry, and regional effects on employment changes. Answers: is decline due to national trends, industry trends, or region-specific factors?

cross_domain_question: Combining Baumol Cost Disease / Stored Energy + Herfindahl-Hirschman Index + Shift-Share Employment Decomposition: what happens when we apply these lenses simultaneously? Where do they agree on high opportunity?
falsifiable_prediction: Sectors scoring highly on ALL of [Baumol Cost Disease / Stored Energy, Herfindahl-Hirschman Index, Shift-Share Employment Decomposition] simultaneously will produce more actionable discoveries than any single method applied alone.

name: Shift-Share Employment Decomposition x Geographic Wage/Cost Arbitrage Analysis

component_methods.name: Shift-Share Employment Decomposition
component_methods.description: Separate national, industry, and regional effects on employment changes. Answers: is decline due to national trends, industry trends, or region-specific factors?

component_methods.name: Geographic Wage/Cost Arbitrage Analysis
component_methods.description: Compare US labor costs with international alternatives to identify arbitrage opportunities (LATAM, Asia, EU).

cross_domain_question: Combining Shift-Share Employment Decomposition + Geographic Wage/Cost Arbitrage Analysis: what happens when we apply these lenses simultaneously? Where do they agree on high opportunity?
falsifiable_prediction: Sectors scoring highly on ALL of [Shift-Share Employment Decomposition, Geographic Wage/Cost Arbitrage Analysis] simultaneously will produce more actionable discoveries than any single method applied alone.
